metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4373 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. This issue affected versions prior to iOS 12.1, watchOS 5.1, Safari 12.0.1, iTunes 12.9.1, iCloud for Windows 7.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
